page.title: 04HOUSING IN DUNVANT
page.content: The older houses are easily identified being built of locally quarried stone, Pennant Sandstone,and having slate roofs.Large gardens are a feature of many of them,enabling the residents to be self-sufficient in vegetables and fruit and creating an interest which has resulted in a very large and active gardening society. Newer houses are of brick construction with cement tiled roofs.The smaller sites on which they are built are indicative of modern suburban develop- ment and rising land costs.Over 90 per cent of houses in the area are privately owned with a small Council- owned development in this village and also in Three Crosses and Upper Killay villages nearby.
